snippet: Shirin Ebadi, the human rights lawyer and Nobel laureate, said the Western-backed sanctions over Iran’s nuclear program were misdirected, hurting the Iranian people.
abstract: Shirin Ebadi, human rights lawyer and Nobel laureate, believes Western-backed sanctions over Iran’s nuclear program are misdirected and are hurting the Iranian people; sanctions have contributed to acute shortages of foreign goods there, rising inflation and unemployment and a sharply devalued currency.
lead_paragraph: Shirin Ebadi, the human rights lawyer and Nobel laureate, said the Western-backed sanctions over Iran’s nuclear program were misdirected, hurting the Iranian people.

headline.seo: Iran’s Nobel Laureate Concerned About Sanctions
headline.main: Iranian Dissident Opposes Sanctions on Tehran

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
